title: some-serifs
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Some-serifs**

A term coined by [David Berlow](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/wiki/David%20Berlow) to refer to sans typefaces in which "only some of the charaters have serifs."

See also [Semi-serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Semi-serif).

**Discussion:**  
 [The Best Term for a Typeface That Combines Elements of Both Serif and Sans Serif?](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/node/29946)  
 [How does the serif on a sans-serif i increase legibility/readability?](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/node/38217)  
 [Berlow's Prelude font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023061520/http:/typophile.com/node/58996)
author: paul d hunt
